keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back, died after a brief struggle with police during an investigation into a break-in at a home in Oakland.

Martin was a 31st overall pick in the 2012 NFL Draft, playing primarily for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, where he achieved significant statistical success and earned multiple All-Pro and Pro Bowl honors.
He finished his career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, and was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers history.
The incident sparked public attention on police interactions with individuals, particularly those with public profiles, and raised concerns about use of force during detainment.
The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers also issued a statement honoring his legacy.
An autopsy has been scheduled, and a cause of death has not been released.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, best known for his career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police officers during a break-in investigation. The incident occurred early Saturday, and he was transported to a hospital where he passed away at age 36. A cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is scheduled. Martin, a 31st overall draft pick in 2012, had a successful career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning All-Pro honors and Pro Bowl selections. His family, the Buccaneers, and Oakland officials expressed condolences, highlighting his legacy and the broader societal implications of police interactions with public figures. The case raises questions about the use of force during detentions and underscores the need for transparency in law enforcement actions.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Police Detention
